title: 112_s1659
content:
ACCOUNTABILITY FOR BROADBAND STIMULUS FUNDS. The Administrator of the Rural Utilities Service or the Assistant Secretary of Commerce for Communications and Information can terminate awards under the Broadband Initiatives Program or the Broadband Technology Opportunities Program for reasons like insufficient performance, wasteful or fraudulent spending. Upon termination, the equivalent amount of the award, less allowable costs, will be deobligated and returned to the Treasury. The Administrator or Assistant Secretary can terminate awards under the Broadband Initiatives Program or the Broadband Technology Opportunities Program for various reasons. Upon termination, the amount of the award, less allowable costs, will be deobligated and returned to the Treasury within 30 days. Corrective measures will be taken to prevent funds from being expended during the termination process, and the recipient must provide an accurate accounting of the terminated award. Upon termination, the recipient must provide a complete and accurate accounting of any unexpended award funds. SEC. 2. DISPOSITION OF UNUSED FUNDS.

The Administrator of the Rural Utilities Service or the Assistant Secretary of Commerce for Communications and Information must return recoverable award amounts, less allowable costs, to the Treasury if the award is returned or disclaimed by the recipient after the enactment of the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009.

SEC. 3. OVERSIGHT AND REPORTING REQUIREMENTS. If officials report noncompliance or improper fund usage in broadband programs under the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009, the Administrator or Assistant Secretary must review the information and decide within 30 days whether to terminate the award. Officials described in this section include the Inspector Generals of the Department of Agriculture and Commerce, as well as the Comptroller General of the United States. Congressional notification must be provided within 3 days of a determination to relevant committees. The notification to Congress must be provided within 3 days of a determination by specified officials, including Inspector Generals and the Comptroller General. It should include an explanation of the determination and any resulting actions taken. SEC. 4 of the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009 is amended to change "may" to "shall" and remove a clause about awarding funds competitively. SEC. 5 defines "award" to include grants and loans.
